item.title: Kristen add a quote by Stephen Fry
item.description: "If a thing can be said in ten words, I may be relied upon to take a hundred to say it. I ought to apologize for that. I ought to prune, pare and extirpate excess growth, but I will not. I like words—strike that, I love words—and while I am fond of the condensed and economical use of them in poetry, in song lyrics, in Twitter, in good journalism and smart advertising, I love the luxuriant profusion and mad scatter of them too." -- Stephen Fry

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A woman of seven and twenty, said Marianne, after pausing a moment, can never hope to feel or inspire affection again." -- Jane Austen
